intro: Pycreus delavayi, commonly known as Delavay's pycreus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Pycreus delavayi is often found in moist, shaded habitats at high altitudes.
